english: split beans; bean halves; broad-bean pieces; fermented bean bits

etymology.description: 豆 (bean) + 瓣 (segment/petal) = split bean pieces.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to halves or segments of beans, especially broad beans; by extension, the split fermented bits used in seasonings like 豆瓣酱.

examples.chinese: 我买了一些干的豆瓣，用来煮汤(我買了一些乾的豆瓣，用來煮湯)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yīxiē gān de dòubàn, yòng lái zhǔ tāng.
examples.english: I bought some dried bean halves to make soup.

examples.chinese: 四川菜常用发酵的豆瓣来做调味，比如豆瓣酱(四川菜常用發酵的豆瓣來做調味，比如豆瓣醬)。
examples.pinyin: Sìchuān cài cháng yòng fājiào de dòubàn lái zuò tiáowèi, bǐrú dòubànjiàng.
examples.english: Sichuan cuisine often uses fermented bean bits for seasoning, such as in doubanjiang.

examples.chinese: 这些豆瓣太碎了，挑一些完整的(這些豆瓣太碎了，挑一些完整的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèxiē dòubàn tài suì le, tiāo yīxiē wánzhěng de.
examples.english: These bean halves are too broken; pick out some intact ones.
